definition:
[*MATLAB*]{}, short for [*MATrix LABoratory*]{}, is a computer algebra
system produced by MathWorks. It was developed by Cleve Moler at the
University of New Mexico, the first commercial version came out in 1984.
The syntax of MATLAB is called [*M-code*]{}. Optionally, MATLAB can be
coupled with the Maple kernel.
